testsuite.name: Test
testsuite.system-out: ?[1;31m Start test 1?[0m > /help It means that from now on the program must receive the addition + and subtraction - operators as an input to distinguish operations from each other. It must support both unary and binary minus operators. Moreover, If the user has entered several same operators following each other, the program still should work (like Java or Python REPL). Also, as you remember from school math, two adjacent minus signs turn into a plus. Therefore, if the user inputs --, it should be read as +; if they input ----, it should be read as ++, and so on. The smart calculator ought to have such a feature. > > /exit Bye! ?[1;31m Start test 2?[0m > 7 + 1 + 4 12 > 23 - 17 - 13 -7 > 33 + 21 + 11 + 49 - 32 - 9 + 1 - 80 + 4 -2 > 101 101 > -302 -302 > > 10 - 7 - 3 0 > 5 --- 2 ++++++ 4 -- 2 ---- 1 10 > /exit Bye! ?[1;31m Start test 3?[0m > 123+ Invalid expression > 321- Invalid expression > +7 7 > /exit Bye! ?[1;31m Start test 4?[0m > abc Invalid expression > one + two + three Invalid expression > /go Unknown command > /exit Bye!
